bwwExcerpt: The problem, intermittently, is the tone. The director, Michael Wilson, a Foote expert, for some reason lets much of the first act play like comedy. Humor is there in the script, no doubt, especially in the animosity between the two women; when Jessie Mae fumes, Carrie feigns subservience, then does exactly what she wants to anyway. But Williamsâ€™s hauteur and stupendous beauty throw the scale out of whack, and Tyson overcompensates with antic old-ladyisms.
